title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts and Bucks - BBC News
summary: luton airport expecting one of busiest christmas periods ever .
weather : dry morning , becoming wet and very windy by this evening .

documents.title: goodbye for now and merry christmas
text: well , that 's it for the day from all the team here at local live for beds , herts and bucks .
we 're off to eat our bodyweight in mince pies and drink the odd christmas tipple , but will be back with no christmas hangover on wednesday , 28 december from 08:00 .
it 's been a busy 2016 for us and one of the highlights of the day is finding out that airlander 10 will be back flying over the skies of cardington in the new year .
we hope you have a fantastic festive time and that santa brings you all healthy and happy christmas .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: road changes in bletchley cause confusion
text: a new road layout is causing confusion for some motorists in bletchley .
the town 's high street now has a one-way system , but it seems like not everyone has noticed .
jo got in touch to let us know , so i 've been to see what 's been going on .

so far i 've seen lots of people not following the new signage and have been told it 's `` nutty '' , `` does n't make sense '' , `` no-one was notified '' and that it `` worked before '' so why change it now .
i was even stopped by a few people who told me there had already been too many `` near-misses '' .
the bbc contacted the council for a response and has yet to hear from them .
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: overnight weather : a dry night after heavy rain clears
text: a brief period of heavy rain and gusty wind are possible at first , but clearing to the east by about 20:00 , leaving a dry night with clear skies across the bbc east region .
strong southwesterly winds at first with some gusts over 50mph ( 80 km/h ) possible , but winds easing to moderate after the rain clears as the temperature dips to 2-4c ( upper 30sf ) .
christmas eve will be dry and long spells of sunshine , but turning cloudier later from the west , with the temperature peaking at 9-10c ( upper 40sf ) .
visit bbc weather for a more detailed forecast where you are .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: workers threatened with knife at luton post office
text: staff at a shop in luton have been threatened with a knife after two masked men `` burst in '' and stole cash .
bedfordshire police says one man was left with head injuries after `` the nasty incident '' in the post office on culverhouse road at about 07:10 today .
the injured man was left `` extremely shaken '' .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : fallen tree causing train delays
text: a fallen tree has damaged overhead electric wires near audley end , meaning trains are now running at a reduced speed .
there are currently up to 15 minutes delays to journeys running through the area .
this is expected to continue until approximately 19:30 .
network rail staff are working to remove the tree as quickly as possible .
due to a fallen tree damaging the overhead electric wires at # audleyend trains have to run at reduced speed on all lines .
js
new : delays between cambridge and stansted airport expected until 19:30 # audleyend

documents.title: travel : car on fire causing hold-ups on m1 by j6
text: one lane is currently closed on the m1 in hertfordshire and there 's queuing traffic northbound at j6 , north watford , because of a car fire .
congestion goes back to j5 , at watford .
2 crews , 1 x hemel hempstead and 1 x garston attending car fire m1 junction 6 northbound
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : fire crews attend accident in stacey bushes
text: bucks and mk fire says three cars are involved in an accident in stacey bushes and firefighters are using hydraulic rescue equipment to release a casualty .
latest incident : crews have been called to report of collision at junction of great monks street and heathfield , stacey bushes , mk

documents.title: airlander 10 : 2017 is 'going to be exciting '
text: and here 's how hybrid air vehicles decided to share their happy news about airlander 10 today .
feeling festive yet ?
2016 was a momentous year , with # airlander 's first flight making aviation history .
2017 is going to be exciting too :
will we have to wait long into the new year to see her back in the air ?
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mother and two children missing from luton
text: police are growing concerned for the welfare of a missing luton mother and her two children who have not been seen for over a week .
angela lambert , 45 , from winton close , luton and her children , six-year-old cyrus and two-year-old maryam have't been seen since 11:30 on 15 december .
a police spokesman said she went by a `` number of aliases '' , adding : `` if anyone sees a woman and two children matching their description i would encourage them to contact us . ''

documents.title: airlander 10 : what a year it 's been
text: it 's been a year of mixed emotions for the team behind airlander 10 .
in august the crew , based at hangar one at cardington airfield , saw the aircraft take off on its maiden flight .
just a few weeks later they witnessed a ' '' heavy landing '' , which put it out of action for the rest of the year , whilst it was repaired .
here are some interesting facts and figures for you .

documents.title: airlander 10 : the sky 's the limit
text: an early christmas present has been revealed by the people behind the airlander 10 , the world 's longest aircraft .
it will be back in the bedfordshire skies from next year .
hybrid air vehicles says the undercarriage , damaged when the ship , named martha gwyn , `` landed heavily '' on only its second flight , has been repaired .
over the christmas period the new cockpit will be painted and then the windscreens fitted .
next will be a series of rigorous tests and then the aircraft can continue its flight test programme .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch out kids , santa 's nearly on his way
text: and it looks like santa is now cleared for take-off !
santa 's passed the security check and is ready to fly !
although , he did n't take his belt off
very well spotted !
did u charge him £ 8 to park his sleigh for 35 mins ?
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: the christmas take-off at luton airport
text: today i 've been in luton seeing how the airport is coping with one of its busiest days .
in total about 45,000 passengers are expected in and out .
so far things have been calm but busy , with everything running smoothly and i 'm not aware of any delays .
passengers have told me they 're very relieved that the planned baggage-handlers strike was called off .
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: stolen horse sculptor is award-winning artist
text: john w mills , the artist who created the stolen statue , is one of britain 's most distinguished sculptors .
he was made fellow of the royal british society of sculptors in 1982 and was awarded the otto beit medal in 1983 for his work on `` curved neck grace '' .
he 's most famous for creating the `` monument to the women of world ii '' in whitehall .
he also created the national firefighters ' memorial outside st paul 's cathedral , commemorating the firefighters who died in the blitz .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sculptor helps to identify stolen horse
text: the rightful owner of `` curved neck grace '' purchased the sculpture in 1983 and displayed it in her garden in st ipployts where it remained for 26 years before it was stolen in september 2009 .
it was made in the same year by john w mills .
he has described the work as a favourite piece , and says he 's `` amazed '' it 's been found again , as normally stolen items were `` sold for scrap taken out of the country or destroyed '' .
mr mills has nothing but praise for the police as `` they brought the horse here for me to identify . ''
he added if it ever went up for auction again , he 'd like the opportunity to work on it again and `` make sure it 's in good condition '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stolen statue found on caravan site in dunstable
text: by the end of november the operation scorpion team at herts police made inquiries about the horse statue and liaised with the sculptor john w mills , so he could identify it .
the statue was on display at a caravan site in dunstable , and police say it was bought from an antique fair in shepherd 's bush , about seven years ago .
they added the new owner was `` shocked '' to discover it had been stolen , but `` understood it needed to be returned '' .
as the statue was not found around the time of the original theft , the rightful owner was compensated by their insurance company , but has since died .
the sculpture , 'curved neck grace ' , is now with the insurance company .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: posh snap up st albans striker
text: meanwhile , peterborough united have announced the signing of st albans city striker junior morias for an undisclosed fee .
the 21-year-old will sign a two-and-a-half-year contract on new year 's day , with the option of another year , and will link up with his new team-mates ahead of the fixture with scunthorpe united .
manager grant mccann said : `` he has scored some great goals already this season for st albans and we are pleased to have secured his signature .
`` he is a lovely lad and he is desperate to succeed .
`` junior has been in the building with us for a few weeks and has been getting up to speed with our sessions . ''

st albans co-owner lawrence levy said : `` i am very pleased that this club has given a talented player the platform to progress to the football league - i 'm sure he will go on to have a fantastic career . ''
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: horse sculpture found after tv appearance
text: hertfordshire police has confirmed that it has recovered a sculpture worth tens of thousands of pounds after it was stolen from a garden in st ipployts in september 2009 .
the work of art called `` curved neck grace '' was created by john w mills in 1983 .
it was discovered after an acquaintance of the original owner spotted it on a bbc inside out show filmed in dunstable and contacted the police .
the investigation was then passed on to north herts ' operation scorpion team .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sculptor 'amazed ' by stolen statue spot
text: sculptor 'amazed ' by stolen statue spot

documents.title: thieves attempt to blow up cash machine
text: thieves have attempted to blow up a cash machine at a petrol station in hertfordshire .
police say they tried to use petrol or gas to attack the machine at the bp station on the a505 between baldock and royston , at about 03:00 today .
a lane of the carriageway which was closed by the police , has now been reopened .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: horse sculpture recovered a year after being stolen from garden
text: one of the most bizarre stories we 've come across , as reported in the comet , is the story of a horse sculpture , created by the english sculptor john w mills in 1983 , which has been found seven years after it was stolen from a st ippolyts garden .
it was actually spotted by an eagle-eyed viewer of bbc east show inside out .
she knew the original owner and contacted the police .
we 'll bring you more on this story when we get it .

documents.title: bedford charity helps homeless mother turn her life around
text: a mother who found herself homeless after fleeing domestic violence has had her life transformed , because of the help she has received from a bedford charity .
angel came to bedford about three years go , but now has a job and a flat after being assisted by the king 's arms church .
she is now counselling , helping other people who have been in similar situations .
she says the past few years have been a really good as she 's been welcomed by the church , is now getting the support she needs .
author: Matt Lockwood
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: premiership rugby half-term report
text: premiership rugby half-term report
author: Jeremy Guscott
Rugby union analyst, BBC Sport

documents.title: wonder strikes washed out & new rivalries
text: wonder strikes washed out & new rivalries
author: Andrew Aloia
BBC Sport

documents.title: guscott 's premiership half-term report
text: guscott 's premiership half-term report

documents.title: flat closed in letchworth after months of 'anti-social ' behaviour
text: after months of anti-social behaviour including arguments , noisy visitors and suspected drug use , a property in letchworth has been served with a closure order .
it means for the next three months , no-one can enter the propety in ivel court , or they risk being being arrested .
police worked with north herts homes and north herts district council to close the property down .

jeanette dallimore , from the council , says : `` by taking this action to close the property , we hope to provide neighbours and the wider community with some respite from the ongoing issues at the address . ''

documents.title: 'irreplaceable ' jewelery stolen from hertfordshire home
text: a large number of `` sentimental and irreplaceable '' items , have been stolen from a home in bovingdon , hertfordshire .
police have only just released information about the burgarly that happened during the day on 3 december .
some of items that were taken included :
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ighalo : africa cup of nations a tough time for nigeriafootball
text: watford striker odion ighalo says january 's africa cup of nations in gabon will be a sad chapter for nigerian football .
after failing to qualify for a second straight nations cup the fans and players of the 2013 champions will have to watch from the sidelines again .
the 27-year-old says the reality of their failure will really hit home when the tournament kicks off on 14 january .

documents.title: travel : queues at luton airport
text: as we 've just reported , on the day luton airport is expecting to be one of its busiest of the year , traffic is already building in the area .
there 's currently queuing traffic on airport approach road inbound in luton , from the holiday inn roundabout .
travel time is 10 minutes .
christmas is a busy time of the year at lla so there may be more traffic on the roads than normal .
please allow extra time for your journey .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: luton airport expecting one of the busiest ever christmas periods
text: london luton airport is advising passengers to allow extra time for their journey as the christmas rush gets under way .
it says not only is this one of their busiest times of the year , it will be one of the busiest christmases ever .
neil bradford , from the airport , says : `` we 're expecting 400,000 passengers between now and 2 january .
`` the busiest day of those christmas holidays is today where we 're expecting 45,000 passengers , so we 've laid on extra staff and increased the number of multi-lingual hosts . ''

documents.title: that moment when your mum and then your gran calls
text: not best to answer at the wheel though this driver was stopped by police in last night .
we 're trying to find out more details from police about where it happened .
a driver has just been stopped driving whilst on the phone , twice , in 20 minutes , by the same officer .
reported times 2 !
surely that warrants court and a harsher punishment ? ?
hopefully it will .
unfortunately we do n't make the decision , we purely report and hope common sense prevails
must be frustrating for you .
disgusting disregard of law , other road users , pedestrians etc .
selfish idiot
christmas howler
doh !
do you know where this happened ?
i 'll put up something on the local bbc website .
shit for brains .
sure nobody died , it must be okay .
some people are just too stupid to be allowed to use the road .
should be banned , though that probably would n't stop them
this makes my blood boil
words fail me .
make him drive over the phone accident waiting to happen

documents.title: weather : wet and very windy this evening
text: it will be breezy but dry this morning with sunny spells .
however , the wind will increase during the afternoon and heavy rain and strong gusty winds will sweep in later , bringing difficult driving conditions during rush hour with a high of 10c ( 50f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: ho ho hello
text: we 're almost there now , are n't we
welcome back to local live again on christmas eve-eve , where we 'll keep you up-to-date with the latest news in the three counties .
( this is my tree by the way ^ - not too bad , ay ? )
no doubt you 'll notice it 's pretty quiet on our roads this morning , but i imagine it 's a different at our supermarkets .
we 'll report on any cranberry chaos we see around , plus bring you this morning 's main stories shortly .
so put down the wrapping paper and tape , pull up a chair with some gluhwein and stay with us until 18:00 .
get in touch with your stories and of your family being festive by dropping us an email , tweet or message on facebook .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for your company .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with more news , weather , travel and sport updates - but any breaking news will be posted here overnight .
before we go , here 's a lovely photo of the royston sky from our bbc weather watcher `` echo echo '' .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wales grand slam captain gwilliam dies
text: wales grand slam captain gwilliam dies

documents.title: bedford prison : more staff being recruited
text: the conservative mp for bedford says wings closed after a riot at bedford prison wo n't re-open until more staff are recruited .
a riot last month left much of the prison unusable - with under-staffing and overcrowding blamed as the cause .

during a visit today , richard fuller said : `` part of the issue here is the enormous stress that prison officers are under , because there are n't sufficient people in prison officer roles looking after that number of prisoners .
`` it would be a mistake in my view to bring prisoners back until the issue of prison officer numbers increases . ''
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: pedestrian struck by lorry dies
text: a pedestrian has been killed after being struck by a lorry in buckingham .
it happened at 16:00 yesterday on the a421 , near to the tesco roundabout .
the woman , who was in her 60s and lived in buckingham , died at the scene .
the woman 's next-of-kin have been informed .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: guscott 's premiership half-term report
text: guscott 's premiership half-term report

documents.title: british pub to be recreated in far east
text: british pub to be recreated in far east

documents.title: premiership rugby half-term report
text: premiership rugby half-term report

documents.title: lurcher found tied to tree in abbots langley
text: the rspca is appealing for information after a lurcher dog was found tied to a tree on a footpath in abbots langley .
the footpath in bedmond is near a busy housing estate surrounded by fields , so it is hoped somebody may have seen how he came to be there .
he is physically well , but not micro-chipped so his owner can not be traced .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: stolen dog believed to be in hertfordshire
text: a dog which was stolen in sussex in august is believed to be in hertfordshire .
tobias the chihuahua went missing from his home in chichester on 6 august and nothing had been heard about him until his owner received a telephone call last friday .
a woman from hertfordshire said that her daughter had bought tobias for £ 700 and named him billy .
she went on to explain how her daughter had taken him to be microchipped when they discovered he belonged to someone else .
police said the woman then said the owner in sussex would have to speak to her daughter , and hung up .
if you recognise tobias/billy , police would like to hear from you .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: father christmas egged in festive float attack
text: father christmas was pelted with eggs in luton last night , as keech hos care 's annual christmas float was targeted .
the float was travelling along carlton crescent when the attack happened .
the float 's train smiley sam and other volunteers were also targeted , which led to the team ending the parade early and returning to base .
lorna milton , from keech hos care , said : `` we 're really disappointed .

we are a charity , we 're out there at christmas spreading joy and cheer to the children and the families of luton - the last thing we want is for smiley sam and our volunteers to get a few eggs thrown at them . ''
the incident has been reported to police and keech hos care are carrying out their own investigation .

documents.title: lunchtime weather : dry and bright
text: after a chilly start it will be a dry and bright day for the rest of today .
there will be a light south-westerly wind and plenty of sunshine through the afternoon .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pd finn 'loving being back at work '
text: we mentioned yesterday that police dog finn made an arrest on his first day back at work , after being stabbed during an incident in stevenage .
these lovely of finn were tweeted this morning .
clearly he loves being back in action !
here 's pd finn who was back on shift with handler pc dave wardell last night .
he 's loving being back at work with dave !
# policedogs
@ twitterid business as usual as far as finn is concerned i think
@ twitterid fantastic to see after the trials that finn and dave have been through over the past few weeks !
@ twitterid i bet all the other gp dogs want to copy his hair do
glad finn is ok and back at work deserves a medal finn does .
you take care pd finn .

sorry we run out of chips
excellent news that you are back pd finn and handler dave crime busting duo back where you belong
@ twitterid gorgeous boy .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dumped hamsters named after santa 's reindeer
text: six hamsters are being cared for by the rspca after they were dumped in a cage on a luton street .
seven hamsters were taken to southridge animal centre after the discovery was made , but one died shortly after arriving .
the surviving hamsters have been named rudolph , blitzen , prancer , vixen , dancer and comet after santa 's reindeer .
rspca animal collection officer , kate wright , said : `` they were in such a terrible way when they were found .
their cage was filthy and some of them had wounds , presumably from fighting . ''
the charity is urging anyone with information to contact them .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a41 'worst road in country ' for littering
text: motorists using the a41 from watford to aylesbury have told us it is one of the worst roads for littering in the country .
part of the problem is the road is now only cleared once a year , down from every six months , due to council cutbacks .

the leader of the liberal democrats at dacorum borough council , ron tindall , told bbc three counties radio : `` the problem is the uncaring nature of motorists who just seem to throw their rubbish out of their car windows , it 's disgusting . ''
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: girl , 9 , brings some festive cheer to the ambulance service
text: such a lovely letter and fantastic drawing of rudolph , that we had to share it as our christmas # thankyouthursday .

documents.title: luton foodbank hands out record-breaking number of parcels
text: luton foodbank has revealed it handed out a record-breaking 335 food parcels last week .
that 's the highest number in a single week since it first opened in april 2013 .
the foodbank is blaming benefit cuts and an increase in homelessness for the rise in demand .
i went to meet project director salma khan , who told me `` it 's a phenomenal number to give out '' .
`` christmas is coming up and people are buying presents - they have n't got enough money for food , '' she said .
author: Matthew Lockwood
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: 'enough is enough ' says council leader over compost plant stench
text: people in elstree and borehamwood say the stench from a nearby tip is so bad it 's making them unwell .
they want reviva composting , which has a site in elstree , to control the smell .
a judge ruled the firm needed to find a solution before october , but no action has been taken and residents say they are fed up .
the conservative leader of elstree and borehamwood town council , patricia strack , told us : `` there is no way it can continue there .
we feel that it is time to say 'enough is enough ' - it 's of no benefit to the local community . ''
we contacted reviva composting for comment , but were told it was not something it was willing to discuss .

documents.title: bletchley park harks back to a 1940s ' christmas
text: with christmas just three days away , we 've been given a whistle-stop tour around bletchley park 's enchanting 1940s ' winter wonderland .
baubles have been decorated with designs dating back to the period , while the house has been scented to smell as it would have in the 1940s .
also , children can tell santa what 's on their list in the ballroom grotto , lined with vintage toys .

documents.title: thursday 's weather : colder than yesterday with sunshine later
text: today will be noticeably colder than it was yesterday , and while it should gradually brighten up through the morning , some fog could linger into the afternoon in places .
top temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
watch my full regional forecast :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: hello from beds , herts and bucks live
text: hello and welcome to thursday 's live stream of news across beds , herts and bucks .
between now and 18:00 the team here will bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .
we always love to hear from you , so if you want to get in contact with us throughout the day , then tweet , email or facebook us .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: gang jailed over petrol station blasts
text: gang jailed over petrol station blasts

documents.title: goodbye for now
text: that 's it for the local live news feed today for beds , bucks and herts .
we 're downing tools now , but will them up again at 08:00 tomorrow morning .
you can read all our stories from today by scrolling through the page .
the big story we have featured is the sentencing today of yvonne caylor , who was given a minimum 20-year jail term for murdering her half-sister , nicki collingbourne , with a chicken-shaped pot .
in the meantime , take care and have a great night .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: luton prospect justin agrees new deal
text: luton prospect justin agrees new deal

documents.title: weather : cloudy tonight , sunny but cold tomorrow
text: it 'll be rather cloudy this evening , with the chance of showers across southern counties .
gradually clearing eastwards with clear spells developing from the west later in the night .
temperatures dropping with the risk of a frost .
a low of 1c ( 34f ) .
tomorrow will be a cold day with long spells of sunshine during the morning .
turning a little cloudier later in the day , but staying dry .
clouding over during the night and winds up .
highs of 7c ( 45f ) .
get the latest where you live at bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: nadiya 's festive family feast
text: nadiya hussain - baker , author , broadcaster and winner of the bbc 's the great british bake off in 2015 - serves up a two-hour special showcasing the perfect festive family feast tonight .
recorded exclusively at nadiya 's home in milton keynes , you can join nadiya together with olly smith for a fun-filled two hours of sizzling , slicing and dicing for the whole family .
tune in to bbc radio 2 at 20:00 tonight or catch it on the iplayer later .
author: BBC Radio 2

documents.title: strictly amazing success
text: our saturday nights are a little duller now strictly come dancing has come to an end , but our region can claim part of the show 's continuing success .
it not only featured woburn sands ' greg rutherford this time around , it was also filmed at elstree ( apart from blackpool week , obvs ) .

documents.title: alastair cook : michael vaughan expects england captain to step down
text: former bedford schoolboy alastair cook is `` very close '' to quitting as england captain , believes former skipper michael vaughan .
cook , 31 , said he will `` go home and do some thinking '' over his future , after the 4-0 test series defeat by india .
`` his body language over the last three matches was one where he looks like he might be thinking of calling it a day , '' vaughan told bbc sport .
however , vaughan believes cook is not certain to resign and said taking time to decide was the correct move .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: charlton add barker to backroom staff
text: charlton add barker to backroom staff

documents.title: police forces investigate football-related abuse
text: hertfordshire police says it 's investigating a report of football-related abuse , which is not linked to a professional club .
it follows revelations from professional players who say they were abused as children , which led to people from around the country coming forward to numerous police forces .
thames valley police , which covers buckinghamshire as well as berkshire and oxfordshire , says it 's at the very early stages of investigating a number of reports .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: pensioner continues fight to have footpath removed from side of beds home
text: a bedfordshire man is still fighting to have a footpath removed from the side of his house in maulden after 25 years of campaigning .
alan bowers has spent about £ 150,000 in legal fees after initially having the path moved from a route that technically went through his home .

bedfordshire county council says it 's `` deferred consideration '' of the footpath until the new year , but has asked council officers to work with mid beds district council to `` look at options and costing for carrying out engineering works to the nearby bridleway , in order to make it physically more suitable for shared vehicular and pedestrian traffic '' .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: police dog finds suspect on work return
text: police dog finds suspect on work return

documents.title: recipe 'paw ' disaster as dog attacks christmas cake ingredients
text: most people overindulge just a little ( ahem ) bit at christmas , but for one dog he went a little too far .
milo , a flat-coated retriever , decided to help himself to 500g ( 18oz ) of sultanas left out for owner claudia goldstein 's christmas cake .
eating a form of grape can cause acute kidney injury in dogs and milo needed to have dialysis treatment in hatfield , which left him in intensive care for two weeks .
now one and a half months later he 's fully recovered and back at work as a therapy dog , working in a local primary school and wormwood scrubs prison .

the royal veterinary college ( rvc ) is using milo 's experience as a warning and is asking owners to make sure their pets are kept away from mince pies , christmas cakes and puddings , fruit cakes , bread and butter puddings , and panettones , over the festive period .
all the more for me then !
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police say barrymore should get £ 1
text: police say barrymore should get £ 1

documents.title: weather : dry but rain later
text: the rest of the afternoon will become cloudier and heavy rain is expected this evening .
it was a pretty gloomy morning too , as this photo from bbc weather watcher `` janjan '' shows .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police officer jailed over sexual relationship with rape victim
text: a police officer who had sex in a mcdonald 's toilet with a rape victim she was assigned to help has been jailed for 22 months .
charlotte peters , 33 , from luton , was based in the met 's sexual offences unit and was the victim 's point of contact with the force .
peters , who was called `` predatory '' by the southwark crown court judge , first kissed the victim at a refuge .
she admitted misconduct in public office .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pc jailed for sex with rape victim
text: pc jailed for sex with rape victim

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : half-sister 's blood found in flat
text: during the trial of yvonne caylor at luton crown court , prosecutor john price said the deep wounds on nicki 's wrists `` were not self-inflicted '' .
he said `` a bizarre feature was the fact that in her right hand she was holding by the handle a small hand brush that comes with a dustpan and brush set .
that she was found holding the brush makes it seem that the scene had been staged in some way , possibly to try and resemble a suicide .
if that was the case it was very incompetently done .
the brush would have fallen from the hand before she hit the ground . ''
he said : `` wounds to her wrist indicated they had been inflicted to her body on or shortly before her death .
they were not ty of self inflicted wrist wounds.. she was unconscious but alive when the blade that caused them was applied . ''
the court also heard after the killing caylor cleaned the flat , leaving a knife in a bottle of bleach .
however , five blood stains were found on five pieces of the broken ceramic pot .
one matched nicki 's profile , the other four matched caylor .
her dna was also found on a hot tap in the bathroom and behind the door to the kitchen .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : cps describe 'cold , calculated and callous woman '
text: the police have responded after yvonne caylor was sentenced to a minimum of 20 years in jail today .

det insp fraser wylie said caylor and nicki collingbourne 's relationship had been `` difficult for many years '' and it broke down further when `` caylor entered nicki 's flat and took items from inside '' .
he added : .
`` we know nothing can ever bring nicki back , but we hope today 's sentence brings some comfort to her grieving family . ''

lisa kiff , senior crown prosecutor for thames and chiltern crown prosecution service , said : caylor is clearly an extremely cold , calculated and callous woman and there is no doubt that , when she attacked nicki , she intended to kill her or cause her really serious harm .
this case represents a tragedy for nicki 's family and friends who have been devastated by her death .
i would like to pay tribute to them and the dignity they displayed while hearing the horrific details surrounding nicki 's brutal murder . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : yvonne caylor blames 'dude ' for murder
text: hertfordshire police has released video footage of when it interviewed yvonne caylor after the death of nicki collingbourne .

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : nicki 'lived in fear ' of caylor
text: yvonne caylor , 53 , made herself look like a man before knocking on nicki collingbourne 's flat in letchworth in may this year .
during the trial at luton crown court , it heard ms collingbourne lived in fear of caylor and would not have opened the door if she believed caylor was the caller .
when the 26-year-old recognised her sister under the disguise she tried to shut the door , but caylor barged in .
she then went on to kill her half-sister with a chicken pot and tried to cover it up by making it look like suicide .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: chicken pot half-sister killer jailed
text: chicken pot half-sister killer jailed

documents.title: watch : nicki collingbourne murder case
text: here 's a recap of the case

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : half-sister tried to make killing look like 'suicide '
text: judge michael kay qc said yvonne caylor `` went to the flat in a relatively crude disguise '' .
`` at first glance you were dressed as a man .
you utilised some sort of .
padding to disguise the shape of your body , '' he said .
he added : `` you sustained a serious back injury in 2012 and walked with a stick .
you did not have a stick that day .
you were doing your best to appear you could walk normally .
`` only you know precisely what happened when the door was shut for the final time , '' he told luton crown court .
`` at some point you up a ceramic chicken and brought it down on her head , causing her to fall to the floor .
`` you then smothered nicki collingbourne , which accounts for injuries around her mouth , and attempted to make it look as if nicki collingbourne had committed suicide . ''
author: Sally Chidzoy
BBC Look East home affairs correspondent

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : caylor planned to 'flee the country '
text: on the day nicki collingbourne was murdered by yvonne caylor , the killer was due to stand trial for burgling nicki 's flat in ivel court , letchworth .
the charges arose after ms collingbourne evicted caylor from her flat in october last year .
caylor complained to police that she had been assaulted and when police questioned ms collingbourne , the prosecution said caylor burgled the flat while she was at the police station .
no action was taken against ms collingbourne , but caylor herself was arrested .
she then urged ms collingbourne 's mother rena hibbert-jones , who has since died , to give a false account of who owned the property .
following the killing , caylor made plans to flee the country .
computer searches revealed she was planning to drive to spain and then fly to the united states , where she had lived with her husband until the summer of 2015 .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : relative tells caylor 'goodbye '
text: after the sentencing of yvonne caylor today , a relative looked back at caylor and said `` goodbye '' .
the public gallery at luton crown court was full of grieving relatives .
defence barrister graham trembath qc , said : `` she is going to effectively spend the rest of her life behind bars . ''
author: Sally Chidzoy
BBC Look East home affairs correspondent

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : chicken pot used to murder half-sister
text: below is the pot that was used by yvonne caylor to murder her half-sister , nicki collingbourne .
it 's been released by hertfordshire police showing how they pieced it together .
prosectuor john price qc told luton crown court : `` on the floor were a number of shattered or broken pieces of ceramic .
they turned out to be the fragments of a ceramic kitchen pot that once it was put together it was in the shape of a chicken . ''
mr price said the victim must have been struck on the back of the head with the pot .
he said it had been up , wielded and brought it down on nicki collingbourne 's head with two hands .
`` the nature of the head injury indicates a degree of force applied in causing it to have rendered her unconscious , '' he said .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : mum 's life 'cut short ' by daughter 's killing
text: the family of nicki collingbourne have paid tribute to her , describing her as `` a beautiful young woman with a beautiful soul '' .
they say their lives have been `` completely devastated '' since her death .
nicki 's sister susan hibbert-jones said : `` i miss my little sister .
she was just beginning on life 's journey and had n't experienced half of what she should have done , like getting married and having children .
she would have made a wonderful mum . ''
she added that rena hibbert-jones - nicki 's mother who died before sentencing - was `` so devastated by nicki 's murder that it affected her health so much it cut her life short '' .
`` mum 's last few months on this earth were full of sadness and torment over the loss of her daughter .
my whole family has naturally been affected by the loss of nicki and it is something that we will never , ever get over , '' said susan .

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : judge says half-sister 'violent and dishonest '
text: sentencing yvonne caylor to a minimum of 20 years at luton crown court , judge michael kay qc said caylor was a `` violent , dishonest , deceitful , selfish and heartless woman '' .
he added : `` it was chilling to hear you speak of your sister without a hint of emotion . ''
caylor smiled as she left the dock .
author: Sally Chidzoy
BBC Look East home affairs correspondent

documents.title: nicki collingbourne murder : half-sister 'disguised as a man '
text: cctv footage showed yvonne caylor walking into the building at ivel court , letchworth , and knocking on her sibling 's door disguised in a workman 's jacket .
she then murdered her half-sister with a chicken-shaped ceramic pot , luton crown court was told .
caylor then spent the next three hours making the attack in may look like suicide and cleaned up the flat .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingnicki collingbourne murder : half-sister jailed for minimum 20 years
text: a woman who murdered her half-sister with a chicken-shaped dish while disguised as a man has been jailed for life , with a minimum term of 20 years .
nicki collingbourne , 26 , was found dead in her underwear at her flat in letchworth , hertfordshire , in may .
yvonne caylor ( below ) , 53 , donned a wig and false beard to dupe cctv cameras as she arrived to carry out the crime , luton crown court heard .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: boy seriously hurt in 'vicious ' mk attack
text: a teenage boy has suffered potentially life-changing injuries after being attacked with a baseball bat in milton keynes .
the attack happened at a park in great linford between 19:30 and 20:00 on 14 december .
the boy was one of five teenagers attacked by two men .
he suffered a fractured skull and is still in hospital .
police have described it as a `` vicious attack '' and are appealing for information .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: vassell signs new contract at hatters
text: luton striker isaac vassell has signed a new contract , keeping him at kenilworth road until the summer of 2018 .
the 22-year-old joined the hatters in july after playing for non-league truro .
vassell said : `` i 'm absolutely buzzing , but i know i need to keep doing what i 've been doing and work even harder to improve . ''
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: baker leaving dons 'best interest for me and club '
text: as we reported earlier , richie barker has left mk dons by mutual consent .
in a statement he said : `` it was a decision in the best interests of both me and mk dons .
i 've thoroughly enjoyed my two-and-a-half years at this great club . ''
he added he was `` proud of his achievements '' and will look at back his time with `` fondness '' .
you can read the full statement from the club by clicking the following link .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: corbyn roof protester case dropped
text: the case against a stevenage man who climbed on the roof of jeremy corbyn 's home has been dropped .
robert smith , 34 , who together with martin matthews , 49 , of bookham in surrey , staged a fathers 4 justice protest in august , but denied aggravated trespass .

they were expected to go on trial after a court previously heard they carried out a rooftop protest at the labour leader 's terraced home in islington , north london , on 5 august , but the case against the pair has been `` discontinued '' , westminster magistrates ' court heard .
a crown prosecution service spokesman said : `` this case was originally charged by the police .
`` we reviewed the case in accordance with the code for crown prosecutors and concluded there was insufficient evidence to provide a realistic prospect of conviction .
`` we therefore proposed to the police that the case was discontinued and they agreed with this approach . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a1081 closed in both directions
text: the a1081 is currently closed in both directions between the kidney wood roundabout and the common junction on the luton to harpenden road , because of a crash involving two vehicles .
police were called just after 07:00 after reports of an accident between a grey bmw , black motorcycle and a grey volkswagen passat .
the male motorcyclist has been taken to hospital with serious injuries .
police are still at the scene .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: summer 's coming !
text: that 's right , folks .
today is the shortest day - the point when the north pole is tilted furthest from the sun ( -23.5 degrees , geometry fans ) .
and we know the exact time - 10:44am .
after that , the days get longer , the nights get shorter and soon it 'll be scorchio !
so here are two generic sunny , summer photos to get you in the mood .
no no , do n't thank me .
you 're welcome .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: more than 140 drink drive arrests in first two weeks of thames valley campaign
text: more than 140 motorists have been arrested for drink and drug driving in the first two weeks of the christmas campaign in the thames valley police area - which includes buckinghamshire .
of 142 arrests , 117 were for drink offences , 30 were for drugs and five were for failing to provide a specimen .
eighty eight people have so far been charged .
supt simon dodds , said : `` driving under the influence is a deliberate act .
it is never an accident if you know somebody is driving under the influence - it could even be your friends or family - tell us so we can put a stop to it before it is too late . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: double booze limit pc is sacked
text: double booze limit pc is sacked

documents.title: police killer getaway driver james hurley loses appeal
text: london 's appeal court judges have rejected a bid by a getaway driver to clear his name , following the murder of an off-duty policeman in hertfordshire in 1988 .
james hurley , 54 , took part in an armed robbery in hemel hempstead during which pc frank mason was shot .
he pleaded guilty to robbery but denied murder and told the court of appeal he was intimidated into keeping quiet by charles mcghee , the man who pulled the trigger .
judges told james hurley his appeal was `` frankly incredible '' .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: disguised killer yvonne caylor due for sentencing
text: a woman from hitchin who disguised herself as a man to murder her half-sister at her flat in letchworth is due to be sentenced this morning .
yvonne caylor was found guilty of murdering nicki collingbourne ( by hitting her over the head by what has been described as an egg-shaped casserole dish .
she then tried to stage the scene to make it look like a suicide , luton crown court heard .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pc sacked for turning up to work drunk
text: thames valley police has sacked an officer who turned up to work drunk at amersham police station .
a misconduct hearing heard that when pc graham johnston reported for duty at 07:00 on 20 may , his sergeant suspected he had consumed alcohol so carried out a breath test .
the officer was found to be over the force 's permissible limit .
it was the second time the pc had been found unfit for duty following a breathalyser test .
he was also over the limit in june 2015 .
on that occasion he received management action and was placed on an `` action plan '' for three months .
det ch supt tim de meyer said : `` police officers are required to make tough decisions and carry out physically demanding work .
`` this requires a clear head and so , in the interests of the public and police colleagues , strict rules apply to ensure that officers are not under the influence of alcohol . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police dog finn finds suspect on first day back
text: it seems you ca n't keep a good dog - or a good story about a dog anyway - down .
a hertfordshire police dog , who only returned to work yesterday after being stabbed on duty in october , caught a suspect on his first shift last night .
german shepherd finn found the suspect hiding in a stable block following a road traffic collision .
one person was arrested .
delighted handler pc dave wardell tweeted the news last night
omg the legend is back !
finn just tracked from the scene of a crash to find someone hiding in a stable block .
1 arrested .
you must have felt on top of the world !
oh pd finn , you just carry on surpassing all expectations .
so very proud of you both
we are on cloud nine , so happy .
he absolutely smashed it .
i 'll be putting a bit more to his fund tonight .
you 've had grumpy old me in tears today at your news .
i could n't be happier 4 u
aw thank you .
clearly the bright star of the night was inside and not above the stable .
well done finn .
you did ok by the way too dave .
hehe
haha love it .
my boss has been following the story from the beginning , finn 's recovery is the best news of the year !
thank you .
you could have popped in for a cuppa !
i 'm about a mile away from there .
saw the copter , did n't know you were involved !
haha .
how funny .
we were getting covered in mud at that point and jumping for joy too .
excellent news dave & did n't take him long to get back to it .
hope there were not too many fences !
just a few .
thank you .
that is great news !
well done pd finn you 're a brave dog !
thanks alex .
he 's a great lad .
awesome work you two , what a rollercoaster of emotions that must have been after all you 've been through
it was .
tears of happiness after that .
maybe we should both retire right here and now and bow out on a huge high .
@ davewardell a stable ?
they were n't surrounded by shepherds & wise men were they ? ?
haha .
you could n't make it up .
honestly .
the guy you caught certainly was n't a wise man !
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : outbreaks of rain
text: a rather grey and damp start for most places with outbreaks of rain , although these will be light and patchy .
the middle part of the day should be brighter and drier with some sunshine and a south-westerly breeze .
the evening will bring more rain .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: richie barker leaves mk dons
text: former caretaker manager richie barker has left milton keynes dons by mutual consent .
barker joined as former manager karl robinson 's number two in march 2014 and was in caretaker charge for eight games this season , following robinson 's departure in october .

dons ' chairman pete winkelman says they were keen for barker to stay at stadium mk following the arrival of new manager robbie neilson , and explored a number of options , but felt it was best to go their separate ways .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome back to live updates of news , weather , travel and sport across beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 and the full weather forecast will be with you shortly .

we 'll also have news from the mk dons , where richie barker has left by mutual consent , and from the streets of hertfordshire where the injured police dog finn has made an arrest on his first shift back .
as always , if you want to get in touch throughout the day you can tweet , email or send us a message on facebook .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: today our main stories have been :
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 .
until then , any major incidents will still be reported here .
goodnight all .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for your company .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow but any breaking news will be posted here overnight .
before we go , here 's a lovely from our weather watcher sunny sally of the clear blue sky over silverstone woods .

documents.title: weather : a dry chilly night ahead
text: staying dry this evening with clear skies , allowing a touch of ground frost to develop but becoming milder later as cloud increases from the west .
outbreaks of light and patchy rain by the early hours of the morning .
temperatures down to 1c ( 34f ) .
tomorrow will start misty and a bit damp with some patchy rain , easing to bring drier conditions and highs of 10c ( 50f ) .
get your local forecast from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: st albans bishop 's concerns over deradicalisation scheme
text: the bishop of st albans the rt revd alan smith has expressed concerns about the government prevent deradicalisation programme .
home office minister baroness williams of trafford told the house of lords the government was leading the way in this field in disrupting online activity and providing a counter-narrative .
the bishop said he had heard a very different narrative about prevent from the `` grassroots , '' which was `` profoundly worrying '' .
he said : `` there is growing discontent at the roll-out of the prevent strategy due to a number of things such as religious illiteracy and some heavy-handed actions . ''
he asked if the ministers would be prepared to meet community leaders who wanted to `` try to make this work '' to listen to their concerns and improve the situation .
baroness williams said she was happy to have such a meeting and paid tribute to the work done by the church in this area .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: from the archives : giant chimneys demolished
text: thirty-six years ago this month the london brick company 's eighteen giant chimneys were demolished one by one as part of the plan to clean up in bedfordshire .
about 5,000 people paid to watch the spectacle at the coronation brickworks in kempston hardwick , and local charities benefited .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: local paper round-up
text: let 's have a look at what some of our local papers are discussing today

documents.title: police killer getaway driver loses appeal
text: police killer getaway driver loses appeal

documents.title: striker vassell signs new luton deal
text: striker vassell signs new luton deal

documents.title: watch : police dog finn goes back to work
text: our favourite police dog is returning to work today after being stabbed while attending an incident in stevenage 10 weeks ago .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woodhill inmate death : 'bizarre behaviour ' reported
text: a coroner has heard how an inmate who died at woodhill prison in milton keynes earlier this month was thought to have been suffering from paranoid schizophrenia .
jason basalat was found hanging from a bed frame in his cell on 11 december .
two days earlier he had been a passenger on a bus when he caused it to crash into barriers after grabbing hold of its steering wheel .
mr basalat was remanded in custody and taken to woodhill prison on saturday , 10 december .
shortly after arriving in jail he was reported for `` bizarre behaviour '' .
at 07:15 on sunday , december 11 he was seen in his cell by officers and appeared well .
at 08:05 he was found hanging from his bed .
he was given cpr and taken to a hospital five miles away .
the inquest has been adjourned to june 20 .
author: Sally Chidzoy
BBC Look East home affairs correspondent

documents.title: lunchtime weather : largely dry with sunny spells
text: it 's a largely dry day with some cloud .
sunny spells will gradually develop leading to a brighter day than yesterday , but with temperatures remaining on the chilly side .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 43f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: festive bus 'spreads happiness and joy '
text: festive bus 'spreads happiness and joy '

documents.title: woodhill inmate found hanging in cell , inquest hears
text: a coroner has heard how a man died earlier this month a day after being sent to woodhill prison in milton keynes .
jason basalat was found hanging in his cell on 11 december .

at the opening of an inquest this morning , the coroner was told the 52-year-old was known to mental health services and had been remanded into custody by magistrates in northamptonshire after grabbing the steering wheel of a bus .
his death follows six suicides at the prison so far this year .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton town supporter saves blackpool fan 's life
text: a luton town supporter has insisted he 's not a hero after saving a blackpool man 's life at the weekend .
matt davis had travelled to lancashire to watch the hatters , but while he was having a pre-game drink at a pub in poulton , regular keith king collapsed .
mr davis quickly performed cpr to save his life .
speaking to andy collins on bbc three counties radio , mr davis said : `` people are saying i 'm a hero .
i do n't feel like a hero . ''
he went on to praise the life-saving defibrillator which was available nearby and revealed mr king was waiting to have a pacemaker fitted and would be home in time for christmas .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: last bank in ampthill set to close
text: the last remaining bank in the mid-bedfordshire town of ampthill will be closing its doors next summer .
some small businesses in the town are worried it will have a major impact on their trade .

natwest has defended the decision , saying the number of transactions in the branch had gone down by 20 % since 2011 and 65 % of branch customers were actively choosing to use online or mobile banking for their day-to-day banking needs .
claire randell , who runs a vintage and retro shop in the town .
said : `` there will be less footfall because customers wo n't come to ampthill to bank and then have a look round ; they will go somewhere else . ''

documents.title: woodhill inmate death : inquest set to open
text: an inquest will open today into the death of an inmate at woodhill prison in milton keynes last sunday .
six prisoners have already taken their lives at the prison this year .
meanwhile , families of two men who died there have been given permission by the high court to take legal action to force the prison to prevent further deaths .
lee jarman 's stepbrother kevin scarlett took his own life at woodhill three years ago .
he told andy collins on bbc three counties radio that yet another death at the prison `` brings it all back again '' .
he said he hoped the high court judgement would `` force the prison legally to implement recommendations to keep prisoners safe '' .
a spokesperson from the ministry of justice said : `` mental health in custody is taken extremely seriously and there are a range of measures already in place to help support prisoners .
`` but we recognise that more can be done .

that is why have invested in specialist mental health training for prison officers , allocated more funding for prison safety and have launched a suicide and self-harm reduction project to address the increase in self-inflicted deaths and self-harm in our prisons . ''

documents.title: tuesday 's weather : mainly dry with some spells of sunshine
text: the cloud will break up gradually , followed by some decent spells of sunshine .
it should be dry , although there is a chance the west of the region could get one of two showers later .
top temperature ranging from 4c to 7c ( 39c - 45f ) .
watch my full regional forecast here :
for a more detailed forecast where you are , visit bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning and welcome back to live updates of news , weather , travel and sport across beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 and the full weather forecast will be with you shortly .
as always , if you want to get in touch throughout the day you can tweet , email or send us a message on facebook .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: goodnight
text: it 's been a very busy day with a lot of big court cases concluding .
on a cheerier note , stabbed police dog finn was declared fit today and will be back on duty tomorrow .
which is when we will be back too , from 08:00 .
until then , any major incidents will still be reported here .
goodnight .
author: Nikki Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bus crash : investigation under way
text: here 's another view of the bus that crashed into a house in holmer green over the weekend .
these come from the ambulance service .
the bus has now been removed from the house .
bus company carousel says the driver had a good record and had been employed for 16 months .
it also said there were no reported defects on the bus prior to the accident .
the driver has been `` relieved of driving duties '' while an investigation is carried out .
author: Nikki Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cold night and drizzle tomorrow morning
text: it 'll be a cloudy night with a few showers and some clear intervals .
some patchy mist and frost is likely , with temperatures in rural spots possibly dropping down close to freezing ( 32f ) .
after a cloudy , misty start , with some drizzle in places , tuesday should be largely dry with bright or sunny spells developing , and a high of 7c ( 45f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: pd finn fit for duty
text: police dog finn has been meeting the press today ahead of returning to duty tomorrow .
finn 's handler pc dave wardell told me he 'd feared for his dog 's life after he was stabbed in stevenage 10 weeks ago .
i was a little nervous about getting too close to finn , who seemed fighting fit as you can see !
pd finn the dog you do n't want to mess with .
he 's back on the streets tomorrow .
@ twitterid
author: Usman Azad
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: northampton could be part of oxford-cambridge rail link
text: a report from the government 's national infrastructure commission ( nic ) suggests northampton be included in the oxford-cambridge rail link announced last month .
the commission said northampton was `` an integral part '' of the oxford-milton keynes-cambridge corridor .
the nic interim report says two stretches of east-west rail 's western section could run from northampton to oxford or reading , and from northampton to aylesbury or london marylebone .
northampton borough council also hopes the report will secure support for a north-west northampton bypass , which would run from welford road to round spinney .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: away fan 'saves ' man 's life before match
text: away fan 'saves ' man 's life before match

documents.title: 'semi-conscious ' coach driver , 78 , jailed over m1 deaths
text: we 've heard more from luton crown court , where a coach driver who killed three men and seriously injured a fourth has been jailed .
alan peters , 78 , from gravesend in kent , drove a double decker full of university cheerleaders into the back of a stationary car on the hard shoulder of the m1 near flitwick .
the judge described him as being in a `` state of semi-consciousness '' .
he 'd up the cheerleaders from kent university in canterbury at about 04:20 on valentine 's day last year and was heading to the lg centre in birmingham .
they were between half an hour and an hour late leaving because he had gone to the wrong bus stop , the court was told .
he was doing an estimated speed of 61mph when he hit the stationary car .
the court was told he 'd failed to observe the signs saying the hard shoulder was for emergency use only and he failed to react to the car with its hazard lights clearly showing .

the men who died were ( l-r ) : the driver , 59-year-old carer allan evans , from islington in london , and back seat passengers , 23-year-old roofer and delivery driver nathan reeves and 20-year-old delivery driver tom aldridge , both from newport pagnell .

the passengers ' friend jake dorling ( below ) , from milton keynes , who was in the front passenger seat , suffered a fractured skull , fractured hips , four fractured ribs , nerve damage to his hands and a punctured lung .
he told the trial they 'd stopped to refill the car with oil after a warning light had come on .
the court heard that :
the hearing was told mr peters started driving coaches in 2000 having previously worked in banking and property management .
today his barrister nigel lickley qc , read a reference from the rev angela walker , who got to know him following his wife 's death .
she wrote : `` alan deeply regrets the accident .
he would never willingly hurt anyone .
the scene of accident plays over and over again in his mind .
he has shown deep remorse to those he has hurt .
alan is being punished every day . ''
peters was found guilty last month of causing three deaths and serious injury by dangerous driving .
at the time of this accident you were 76 years of age .
you had other choices available to you .
you could have questioned whether you should have continued as a professional driver at all at that age . ''
author: Nikki Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingseven year sentence for coach driver who killed three men on m1
text: a coach driver who killed three men and seriously injured a fourth when he ploughed into the back of a stationary car on the hard shoulder of the m1 has been sentenced to seven years in prison .

alan peters , now 78 and from gravesend in kent , was in a `` state of semi-consciousness '' when he crashed his double decker into a stationary audi near flitwick , bedfordshire , on valentine 's day 2015 .
author: Nikki Jenkins
BBC Local Live
